question.text: Which of the following is incorrect about spermatogenesis?

options.text: Meiosis-I leads to the formation of secondary spermatocytes
Meiosis-II leads to the formation of spermatids
Production of one sperm and 3 polar bodies
Primary spermatocytes are diploid in nature

solution.text:
Steps involved in Spermatogenesis
 
Step 1 Spermatogonia (2n = 46) are present in the inside wall of seminiferous tubules. Spermatogonium divides mitotically to increase in number.
Step 2 Some spermatogonia (termed as primary spermatocytes) periodically undergo meiosis. A primary spermatocyte completes meiosis-I (reduction division) and gives rise to 2 equal-sized cells called secondary spermatocytes (n = 23).
Step 3 Both secondary spermatocytes undergo meiosis –II (equational division) to produce 2 equal spermatids (n) each.
Step 4 Each spermatid is transformed into spermatozoa (sperms) by the process of spermiogenesis.
Step 5 After spermiogenesis, the head of sperms becomes embedded in the sertoli cells. Sperms are finally released from the seminiferous tubules by the process called spermiation.
